results.title: Vision in our valley
results.brief_description: This film discusses the economic and environmental problems of the Muskingum Watershed, which makes up 1/5 of the State of Ohio. The area was becoming more poor due to frequent floods, droughts and intensive farming. Through co-operation among various agencies, the area has become completely renewed. By explaining how this happened, the film makes suggestions for solutions to similar problems of conservation elsewhere.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: the unit circle
results.creator_credit: Jonathon Dawson and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Gives an activity to determine the mathematical relationship “sine” and shows how to apply the principle of “sine” in measuring the heights of various objects.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: relations
results.creator_credit: Robert Newton and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Opens up with images of Ron Clarke, Donald Campbell and Jack Brabham. Displays the symbols used for expressing familiar mathematical relationships to raise the question of how such relationships can be expressed. Discusses and illustrates several methods of notation.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: motion geometry
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Reviews and illustrates three isometric plane transformations (translation, reflection, rotation). Examines some combinations of these operations and includes tables to show the final results.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: more angles in a circle
results.brief_description: Explores the problem of placing a triangle of known angles so that it is circumscribed by a given circle. Indicates a method for locating one’s position on a map if three landmarks are recognised.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: more about Pythagoras
results.brief_description: Develops some ideas arising from the theorum of Pythagoras, including the notion of irrational numbers. Uses the knowledge of Pythagoras’s theorem to calculate the length of a rafter in a roof.

results.title: Vision in mathematics: linear programming
results.creator_credit: John Walker, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Examines ideas leading to consideration of linear programming, such as the values of various combinations of coins. Also shows the sequence of operations in preparing a linear program for the computer.

results.title: Vision at night
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Royal Air Force and Science Films
results.brief_description: The structure of the eye, and its operation, especially at night: visual purple; rods and cones; scanning; adaptation; pre-adaptation; goggles; the value of special diet for night vision.

results.title: Visible: Out On Television
results.creator_credit: David Bender, David Permut, Tripod Media, Push It Productions, Permut Presentations and Apple Video Programming, LLC
results.brief_description: Explore the history of the LGBTQ movement through the lens of TV in this five-part docuseries. Combining archival footage with new interviews, it looks at homophobia, invisibility, the evolution of LGBTQ characters, and coming out in the TV industry.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.
